page.title: 01TYPICAL VALLEY IN E.SUFFOLK
page.content: The block includes the hamlets of Linstead Parva and Chediston both centred round the village church which date from the 12th and 13th century. A predominantly agricultural area lying on both sides of a shallow east-west valley 10-14 miles from the east coast: until about 20 years ago the farms were mostly under 100 acres but now there are only 5 in this category; only two of the larger farms now have dairy herds and one of these also has a large pig unit. There are also 2 small pig units, 2 fruit farms, one pick-uour-own soft fruit and vegetable farm, one basket maker. Many of the former farm houses are now occupied as private houses mainly by people in business in the area; indigenous inhabitants are a minority group: due to the lack of demand for on-farm labour the younger people tend to move
